segments.text: That overflowing water everywhere is just gross; it's soaking everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's foot in the puddle—doesn't she feel how nasty that is?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her towel's probably getting damp from the splashes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids, climbing for cookies like little thieves in the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's tilting on the wet floor; this is filthy and dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water streaming down the cabinets—imagine the mildew later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's hand out, probably eager for crumbs in this slop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden's tidy, but inside it's turning into a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing dishes near all that standing water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so absorbed she doesn't see the disaster building.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those cookies might fall into the puddle—ruined treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene makes my skin crawl with the uncleanliness.
segments.speaker: PAR
